meanings.definition: To call back or summon again.
meanings.sent1: After losing his keys, he had to resummons his memory to remember where he last saw them.
meanings.sent2: The teacher resummoned the students who had left the classroom without permission.
meanings.sent3: The magician resummoned the rabbit for another magic trick, but this time it brought a carrot along.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph resummoned memories of a long-forgotten summer.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bell resummoned the excitement of the upcoming school break.

meanings.definition: The act of calling back or summoning again.
meanings.sent1: The resummons of the lost hikers by the rescue team was a relief to their families.
meanings.sent2: The resummons of the jury members delayed the trial proceedings.
meanings.sent3: The resummons of the mischievous cat from the neighbor's yard turned into a playful chase.
meanings.sent4: The resummons of the ancient spirits brought a sense of mystery to the village.
meanings.sent5: The resummons of the retired superhero for one last mission captivated the town.
